data.title: Rehberg Name Meaning, Family History, Family Crest & Coats of Arms
data.meta_description: See the Rehberg surname, family crest & coat of arms. Free Search. Uncover the Rehberg surname history for the German Origin. What is the history of the last name Rehberg?
data.text:
Rehberg History, Family Crest & Coats of Arms

Origins Available:

Germany

Loading...

Early Origins of the Rehberg family

The surname Rehberg was first found in Prussia and Denmark, where the name emerged in medieval times as one of the notable families of the region. From the 13th century the surname was identified with the great social and economic evolution which made this territory a landmark contributor to the development of the nation. Bad Rehburg is a village in the borough of Rehburg-Loccum in Lower Saxony and is a former spa resort in the Rehburg Hills range. Rehburg-Loccum is a town in the district of Nienburg of Lower Saxony.

Loading...

Early History of the Rehberg family

This web page shows only a small excerpt of our Rehberg research. Another 142 words (10 lines of text) covering the years 1626 and 1652 are included under the topic Early Rehberg History in all our PDF Extended History products and printed products wherever possible.

Loading...

Rehberg Spelling Variations

Spelling variations of this family name include: Reberg, Reburg, Rhberg, Rehburg, Reiberg, Reiburg, Rechberg, Rechburg, Rechburger and many more.

Loading...

Early Notables of the Rehberg family

More information is included under the topic Early Rehberg Notables in all our PDF Extended History products and printed products wherever possible.

Rehberg Ranking

In the United States, the name Rehberg is the 15,069th most popular surname with an estimated 2,487 people with that name. 1

Loading...

Rehberg migration to the United States +

Some of the first settlers of this family name were:

Rehberg Settlers in United States in the 19th Century

Ludwig Rehberg, who settled in New York, NY in 1851

John Rehberg, who was naturalized in Dubuque Co. Iowa in 1853

Justine Marie Dorothe C Rehberg, who landed in Illinois in 1853 2

Daniel Rehberg, who arrived in Kansas in 1872

Rehberg migration to Canada +

Some of the first settlers of this family name were:

Rehberg Settlers in Canada in the 19th Century

Wilhelm Rehberg, who settled in Quebec in 1851

Contemporary Notables of the name Rehberg (post 1700) +

Hans-Michael Rehberg (1938-2017), German actor who appeared in more than one hundred films since 1945

Friedrich Rehberg (1758-1835), German portrait and historical painter

Scott Joseph Rehberg (b. 1973), former professional American football player

Peter Rehberg (b. 1968), English author of electronic audio works

Walter Rehberg (1900-1957), Swiss concert pianist, composer and writer on musical subjects

Jan Rehberg, American Republican politician, Delegate to Republican National Convention from Montana, 2008 3

Jack Rehberg, American Republican politician, Candidate for U.S. Representative from Montana 2nd District, 1970 3

Dennis R. Rehberg (b. 1955), American Republican politician, Staff for U.S. Rep. Ron Marlenee, 1979-82; Member of Montana State House of Representatives, 1984-91; Lieutenant Governor of Montana, 1991-96 3
